div1.p: Your good letter and enclosures of May 23rd arrived a week or so ago.

Good news about the 12th! Have called Mark and Judy Meadows and they're coming over that night for dinner with the high-light of the evening being, of course, the Neihardt-Cavett (or is it the other way around?) interview late that evening.
Cavett now is aired in KC. He wasn't last April 27th (1971), We get the program over Channel 41, with 10:30 p.m. being his local on-the-air time here.
Have given the word to our Westerners per the enclosed announcement that went out to the boys this week.

Glad to hear aobut the enthusiasm over BLACK ELK. Do you think they'll do another printing? (I've tried to order the new edition from our local supplier but find they can't get copies! Am, of course, anxious for one to bring the Collection up-to-date.) Maybe I'll have to write the publisher for none one of these days soon. Perhaps he can supply one for the 'missing link.'

Am hoping to take a week around the first of August with intentions of Bancroft & Lincoln on the schedule then. It'll be good visiting again. I understand through Marie Vogt that they have 'big things' planned this year in Bancroft.
Must close. Best, of course, to Myrtle and J.D. And a "woof! woof!" (in translation, "Hi") to Jacquot.

THE WESTERNERS
Kansas City Posse
MEETING ANNOUNCEMENT
WHEN? Tuesday, 13 June 1972
WHERE? Hotel Bellerive, 214 E. Armour (Kansas City, Missouri)
TIME? 6-7 PM SOCIAL HOUR; 7-8 PM "LET'S EAT TIME"; 8 til ??? MEETING AND PROGRAM
PROGRAM & SPEAKER: Dr. Harmon Mothershead, Dept. of History, North-western Missouri State College, Marysville, Mo. who'll be telling us about "Financial Exploitation in the West."
Information in his talk is part of research conducted for his new book, The Swan Land and Cattle Company (in Wyoming), published by the Univ. of Okla. Press (1971).
This should be a most interesting program -- one we should all find worth our while to take in the 13th!
DUES PAID YET? Members who've paid their 1972 Active dues will find their 1972 Membership Cards enclosed herein. If you're not in this category -- please remit check for $10 (payable to THE WESTERNERS) to us at our Posse Address (1711 Concord Ct. #303, Kansas City, Mo. 64110) for proper tallying-in.
FROM THE CORONADO PRESS IN LAWRENCE, KANSAS...word received as enclosed herein re: various reprinted publications of Dr. Anderson's.
AND FROM THE WESTERN HISTORY ASSOCIATION...word received as also enclosed herein re: Membership in that organization. We have several of our members "Active" in WHA. It comes to us therefore, 'highly recommended.'
A SPECIAL ADDED NOTE...Westerner co-founder Dr. John G. Neihardt will be interviewed on the Dick Cavett program (ch. 41, 10:30 pm) June 12th. That's a Monday night. Topics to be discussed will probably be Black Elk, the Sioux Holy Man, as written about by Neihardt in his book BLACK ELK SPEAKS, and Neihardt's upcoming auto-biography (which Cavett has written the foreword to).
To get tallied in on the June 13th meeting -- call Tallyman Fred Lee (WA3-6966) evenings or Westerner Bill Goff (HI4-3969) days/evenings. Tell 'em 'how many the 13th.' Or, drop the enclosed reservation in the mails to Tallyman Lee with your count on it (by Friday of this week if you will please!).
SEE YOU THE 13TH?
BRING A GUEST!!
